body.p: The proposals in the exposure draft required that the right of set‑off be legally enforceable in the event of default and in the event of insolvency or bankruptcy of ‘one of the counterparties’ (including the entity itself). There were differing views as to whether the requirement that the right of set‑off must be enforceable in the event of the entity’s default and/or insolvency or bankruptcy changed the criteria in IAS 32 today.
